one.title: FIRST DAY: Read the notes and the references.

questions.questionText: 1. Use this space to record how you have seen God's activity during the week. (How has He provided, answered, comforted, reconciled, guided, etc.?)
2. From the past week's study, what made the most significant impact to you in the notes, lecture, group sharing or personal study?

two.title:
SECOND DAY: Read 2 Samuel 11:1-17.
David ordered a murder to cover his adultery.

questions.questionText: 3. Describe the steps leading to David's sins. What do you learn from this?
4. How have you or will you establish protections to prevent yourself from giving in to temptation?
5. What resources did God provide David to help him in times of weakness? (See Deuteronomy 17:18-20 and 1 Samuel 16:12-13.)

6. What additional resources does God provide His people today? Which are most helpful to you? (For help see Ecclesiastes 4:9-10, John 14:26, Romans 8:34, 1 Corinthians 10:13, Hebrews 4:14-16 or any other Scripture verse.)

three.title:
THIRD DAY: Read 2 Samuel 11:18-27 with Psalm 32.
David married Bathsheba after Uriah was killed.

questions.questionText: 7. Describe how David's sin and cover-up affected others.
8. Describe how David's sin and cover-up affected himself.
9. What lessons from David's experience can you learn and apply to your life?

four.title:
FOURTH DAY: Read 2 Samuel 12:1-23 with Psalm 51.
David repented after Nathan confronted him about his sin.

questions.questionText: 10. What do you learn about David through Nathan's encounter and the subsequent consequences? What is important to remember whether you are the one confronted or confronting another?
11. From both passages, what did David believe about God? How do these attributes of God challenge or comfort you?
12. What lessons do you learn concerning repentance and forgiveness? Which lesson is most helpful in your present circumstances? Why?

five.title:
FIFTH DAY: Read 2 Samuel 12:24-31.
David fathered Solomon and conquered the Ammonites.

questions.questionText: 14. How did both Nathan and Joab prompt David? What qualities did Nathan and Joab demonstrate?
15. How have you experienced God's grace in your own life? How and to whom might you extend grace?

six.title: SIXTH DAY: Review 2 Samuel 11-12 with Psalms 32 and 51.

questions.questionText: 16. What is the most important or challenging thing you learned this week?
